greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: LCM of exponents in prime factorization of n, a(1) = 1.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10080
Index entries for sequences computed from exponents in factorization of n
Index entries for sequences related to lcm's
formula: a(1) = 1; for n > 1, a(n) = lcm(A067029(n), a(A028234(n)). - _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 09 2016
example: n = 180 = 2*2*3*3*5; lcm(2,2,1) = 2; Product(2,2,1) = 4; max(2,2,1) = 2; it deviates both from maximum of exponents (A051903, for the first time at n=72), and product of exponents (A005361, for the first time at n=36).
program: (definec (A072411 n) (if (= 1 n) 1 (lcm (A067029 n) (A072411 (A028234 n))))) ;; _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 09 2016
print([a(n) for n in range(1, 151)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Mar 25 2017
xref: Similar sequences: A001222 (sum of exponents), A005361 (product), A051903 (maximal exponent), A051904 (minimal exponent), A052409 (gcd of exponents), A267115 (bitwise-and), A267116 (bitwise-or), A268387 (bitwise-xor).
Differs from A290107 for the first time at n=144.
After the initial term, differs from A157754 for the first time at n=360.
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Jun 17 2002
ext: a(1) = 1 prepended and the data section filled up to 120 terms by _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 09 2016
